DOC.HEAD: ICI to Buy Atlas Powder
DOC.TEXT: Chemical products giant ICI PLC announced Thursday it has agreed to buy Tyler Corp.'s Atlas Powder Co. to strengthen its position in commercial explosives and detonator products businesses. The agreement is valued at $193 million with ICI assuming $58 million in debts and paying $135 million to Tyler shareholders. The deal is expected to be completed in early 1990. Atlas is a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Dallas-based Tyler. ICI is based in London. Its American operation is ICI Americas, headquartered in Wilmington. ``The United States is the world's largest commercial explosives market and this acquisition will significantly enhance the geographical coverage of ICI's international explosives business and provide additional product opportunities arising from the introduction of ICI technology into the U.S. marketplace,'' said Bob Clark, a top executive of ICI explosives. ICI's explosives business has been based in Toronto since 1988. Last year, the business had sales of $655 million. The business employs about 8,000 people worldwide. Atlas, founded in 1912, manufactures and sells commercial explosives and detonator products almost exclusively in the United States. Atlas operates in 35 states and employs about 1,500 people. It had sales of $198 million in 1988.
